019package org.jgrapes.io.util;
020
021import java.io.IOException;
022import java.io.InputStream;
023import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
024import java.nio.channels.Channels;
025import java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel;
026import java.util.Map;
027import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
028import org.jgrapes.core.EventPipeline;
029import org.jgrapes.io.IOSubchannel;
030import org.jgrapes.io.events.Closed;
031import org.jgrapes.io.events.IOError;
032import org.jgrapes.io.events.IOEvent;
033import org.jgrapes.io.events.Input;
034import org.jgrapes.io.events.Output;
035
036/**
037 * Forwards the content of an input stream as a sequence of {@link Output}
038 * events.
039 */
040@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
041public class InputStreamPipeline implements Runnable {
042
043    private InputStream inStream;
044    private IOSubchannel channel;
045    private EventPipeline eventPipeline;
046    private boolean sendClosed = true;
047    private Map<Object, Object> eventAssociations;
048    private boolean sendInputEvents;
049
050    /**
051     * Creates a new pipeline that sends the data from the given input stream
052     * as events on the given channel, using the given event pipeline.
053     * 
054     * @param in the input stream to read from
055     * @param channel the channel to send to
056     * @param eventPipeline
057     *            the event pipeline used for firing events
058     */
059    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ShortVariable")
060    public InputStreamPipeline(InputStream in, IOSubchannel channel,
061            EventPipeline eventPipeline) {
062        this.inStream = in;
063        this.channel = channel;
064        this.eventPipeline = eventPipeline;
065    }
066
067    /**
068     * Creates a new pipeline that sends the data from the given input stream
069     * as events on the given channel, using the channel's response pipeline.
070     * 
071     * @param in the input stream to read from
072     * @param channel the channel to send to
073     */
074    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ShortVariable")
075    public InputStreamPipeline(InputStream in, IOSubchannel channel) {
076        this(in, channel, channel.responsePipeline());
077    }
078
079    /**
080     * Causes the data to be fired as {@link Input} events rather
081     * than the usual {@link Output} events. 
082     * 
083     * @return the stream for easy chaining
084     */
085    public InputStreamPipeline sendInputEvents() {
086        sendInputEvents = true;
087        return this;
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * Suppresses the sending of a closed event when the stream is closed. 
092     * 
093     * @return the stream for easy chaining
094     */
095    public InputStreamPipeline suppressClosed() {
096        sendClosed = false;
097        return this;
098    }
099
100    /**
101     * Configure associations that are applied to the generated
102     * Output events, see {@link Event#setAssociated}.
103     * 
104     * @param associations the associations to apply
105     * @return the pipeline for easy chaining
106     */
107    public InputStreamPipeline
108            setEventAssociations(Map<Object, Object> associations) {
109        eventAssociations = associations;
110        return this;
111    }
112
113    @Override
114    public void run() {
115        try (ReadableByteChannel inChannel = Channels.newChannel(inStream)) {
116            ManagedBuffer<ByteBuffer> lookAhead = ManagedBuffer.wrap(
117                ByteBuffer.allocate(channel.byteBufferPool().bufferSize()));
118            // First attempt
119            if (lookAhead.fillFromChannel(inChannel) == -1) {
120                ManagedBuffer<ByteBuffer> buffer
121                    = channel.byteBufferPool().acquire();
122                eventPipeline.fire(associate(ioEvent(buffer, true)), channel);
123            } else {
124                while (true) {
125                    // Save data read so far
126                    ManagedBuffer<ByteBuffer> buffer
127                        = channel.byteBufferPool().acquire();
128                    buffer.linkBackingBuffer(lookAhead);
129                    // Get new look ahead
130                    lookAhead = ManagedBuffer.wrap(ByteBuffer.allocate(
131                        channel.byteBufferPool().bufferSize()));
132                    // Next read attempt
133                    boolean eof;
134                    try {
135                        eof = lookAhead.fillFromChannel(inChannel) == -1;
136                    } catch (IOException e) {
137                        buffer.unlockBuffer();
138                        throw e;
139                    }
140                    // Fire "old" data with up-to-date end of record flag.
141                    eventPipeline.fire(associate(ioEvent(buffer, eof)),
142                        channel);
143                    if (eof) {
144                        break;
145                    }
146                }
147            }
148            if (sendClosed) {
149                eventPipeline.fire(associate(new Closed<Void>()), channel);
150            }
151        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
152            // Just stop
153        } catch (IOException e) {
154            eventPipeline.fire(associate(new IOError(null, e)), channel);
155        }
156    }
157
158    private IOEvent<ByteBuffer> ioEvent(ManagedBuffer<ByteBuffer> buffer,
159            boolean eor) {
160        if (sendInputEvents) {
161            return Input.fromSink(buffer, eor);
162        }
163        return Output.fromSink(buffer, eor);
164    }
165
166    private Event<?> associate(Event<?> event) {
167        if (eventAssociations != null) {
168            for (var entry : eventAssociations.entrySet()) {
169                event.setAssociated(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
170            }
171        }
172        return event;
173    }
174
175}
